greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Near primes to Mnr = A001228(26) = 808017424794512875886459904961710757005754368000000000, also called the Monster number, cf. A003131.
comment: Sorted to (increasing distance to Mnr) = ABS(A174818(n));
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..146
Dario A. Alpern, Factorization using the Elliptic Curve Method
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Sporadic Group
example: a(3) = Mnr + 83 = 808017424794512875886459904961710757005754368000000083 is the smallest prime greater than Mnr; Qremarkable: (a(143),a(141)) = (Mnr-9511,Mnr-9509) is a twin prime pair.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 02 2010
